net.openhft.chronicle.bytes

Interface Bytes<Underlying>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Appendable, AutoCloseable, BytesStore<Bytes<Underlying>,Underlying>, ByteStringAppender<Bytes<Underlying>>, CharSequence, Closeable, RandomDataInput, RandomDataOutput<Bytes<Underlying>>, net.openhft.chronicle.core.ReferenceCounted, StreamingDataInput<Bytes<Underlying>>, StreamingDataOutput<Bytes<Underlying>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBytes, MappedBytes, NativeBytes, SubBytes, SubZeroedBytes, VanillaBytes, ZeroedBytes

    public interface Bytes<Underlying>
extends BytesStore<Bytes<Underlying>,Underlying>, StreamingDataInput<Bytes<Underlying>>, StreamingDataOutput<Bytes<Underlying>>, ByteStringAppender<Bytes<Underlying>>

        default String toHexString()

      • isElastic

        boolean isElastic()
        Returns:
        can the Bytes resize when more data is written than it's realCapacity()

      • ensureCapacity

        default void ensureCapacity(long size)
        grow the buffer if the buffer is elastic, if the buffer is not elastic and there is not enough capacity then this method will throws BufferOverflowException
        Parameters:
        size - the capacity that you required
        Throws:
        BufferOverflowException - if the buffer is not elastic and there is not enough space

      • bytesForRead

        default Bytes<Underlying> bytesForRead()
        Creates a slice of the current Bytes based on its position() and limit(). As a sub-section of a Bytes it cannot be elastic.
        Specified by:
        bytesForRead in interface BytesStore<Bytes<Underlying>,Underlying>
        Returns:
        a slice of the existing Bytes where the start is moved to the position and the current limit determines the capacity.

        long address()
      throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtain the underlying address. This is for expert users only.
        Returns:
        the underlying address of the buffer
        Throws:
